INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The filmic representations present in its core symbology capable of representing the dichotomous thinking that integrate society. This article aims to analyze the animated film ?Over the Hedge?, with regard to sustainability, supporting the interaction between animals, which lost part of its forest habitat due to construction of a residential condominium; and humans, residents of this property. For the analysis, there was observational study supported the filmic language, a qualitative approach based on the concept of sustainability. An outcome of the analysis, it appears that on search for individual- -environment harmony, sustainable development is presented as a process of change in which the exploitation of resources, the direction of investments, the orientation of technological development and institutional change can be in harmony when it reinforces the current and future potential to meet human needs and aspiration. For the future, it is suggested that the issue be discussed in a non common place, and a task not reached by that article. It is believed that environmental education can process the development of sustainable and not the reverse. An alternative route may be the evaluative construction that underlies the subjective actions on environmental issues discussed. Keywords: Society. Environment. Sustainability. Environmental Education.

O artigo cientнfico contou com o apoio da Abit, visto que os pesquisadores entrevistaram 70 empresas associadas а Entidade para investigar os efeitos de trкs tipos de eco-inovaзхes (processo, produto e organizacional) no desempenho da indъstria. Sгo objetivos do estudo: analisar a implantaзгo do sistema de cotas na Universidade Federal do Cariri contextualizando a perspectiva do que preconiza o direito a educaзгo com base nos objetivos do milкnio para a promoзгo do desenvolvimento regional sustentбvel; mapear o sistema de cotas na UFCA categorizando-as segundo os parвmetros adotados, com кnfase no curso de graduaзгo em Medicina; identificar os aspectos legais, principiolуgicos e sociais que dгo suporte a constitucionalidade do sistema de cotas na ordem jurнdica brasileira e identificar em que sentido o sistema de cotas implantado efetivou uma polнtica inclusiva do estudante a luz da sustentabilidade. A pesquisa de base qualitativa, se basearб em um estudo de caso, utilizando o estudo de referencial teуrico acerca da temбtica, o estudo documental que norteia o ordenamento legal e a pesquisa de campo, com a coleta e anбlise dos dados. A pesquisa espera contribuir com o fortalecimento de polнticas pъblicas de permanкncia estudantil numa perspectiva ?inclusiva? da cl
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The study analyzes the insertion of affirmative action policy - "quotas", implemented in the course of medical degree from the Federal University of Cariri-UFCA. The impact of such non-discriminatory measures and their correlation with the development of subjects in search of their academic and personal emancipation. The objectives of the study are to analyze the implementation of the quota system at the Federal University of Cariri, contextualizing the perspective of the right to education based on the Millennium promotion of sustainable regional development; mapping the quota system at UFCA categorized according to the adopted parameters, with emphasis on the undergraduate Medicine; identify the legal, principological and social aspects that support constitutionality of the quota system in the Brazilian legal system and to identify the implemented quota system implemented an inclusive policy of the student in the light of sustainability. Qualitative research will be based on a case study using the study of theoretical reference on the subject, the documentary study that guides the legal planning and field research, with the collection and analysis of the data. The search hopes to contribute to the strengthening of public policies for student stay in a "inclusive" perspective of the working class and its impacts on the Cariri of Cearб.
